intro: Leucopogon hirsutus, commonly known as the hairy leucopogon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea tree species. The plant is characterized by its small, pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and summer seasons. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive, somewhat fuzzy appearance. Leucopogon hirsutus is often found in heathlands and dry forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
